Sudoku.Data.Board

Description

This module exports the methods to create a SudokuBoard, the types used to construct one, and all of the methods used to interact with one once it's created.

Synopsis

  • data SqVal
  • data Square
  • data SudokuBoard

Classes

data SqVal Source

Value of a Square, can be 1-9

Instances

Enum SqVal Source 
Eq SqVal Source 
Ord SqVal Source 
Show SqVal Source 

data Square Source

Type for Sudoku square value. Stores value and whether this square was placed at creation of the board or not.

Instances

Eq Square Source 
Show Square Source

Show either the number, or "_" for empty.

data SudokuBoard Source

Type for Sudoku board. Just a 2D list of squares.

Instances

Eq SudokuBoard Source 
Show SudokuBoard Source 

data Location Source

Location on a SudokuGrid - a coordinate pair.

Instances

Eq Location Source 
Show Location Source

Show a location as a tuple of coordinates.

Methods

isEmpty :: Square -> Bool Source

Return whether Square is Empty or not.

Location, Square Generation

toLocation :: String -> String -> Maybe Location Source

Create location from two strings specifying coordinates.

tupleToLocation :: (Int, Int) -> Location Source

Convert tuple of ints to Location.

toSquare :: Bool -> String -> Maybe Square Source

Convert Int to Square (or fail and return Nothing), with original flag as specified.

Board Generation

emptyBoard :: SudokuBoard Source

Create an empty SudokuBoard.

attemptLoad :: String -> SudokuBoard Source

Attempts to load a board from a file. If it fails, an empty board is returned.

Printing

prettyPrint :: SudokuBoard -> String Source

Prints a SudokuBoard nicely.

Board Modification

getBoardValue :: SudokuBoard -> Location -> Square Source

Get the value in a particular square of a Sudoku board.

setBoardValue :: SudokuBoard -> Location -> Square -> SudokuBoard Source

Returns a SudokuBoard with the value at the two indices modified. Original values are not modified.

eraseBoardValue :: SudokuBoard -> Location -> SudokuBoard Source

Erase square of a SudokuBoard if it isn't original.

resetBoard :: SudokuBoard -> SudokuBoard Source

Reset board. Values placed when the board was created are not changed.

checkBoard :: SudokuBoard -> [Location] Source

Checks if a SudokuBoard is currently valid or not. Checks all rows, columns, and subgrids with checkList and returns a list of squares in error.
